conclusion: Understanding the motion of the charged particle in the magnetic fields.
Initial conditions: particle has charge +q, mass m, enters B1 perpendicular to MN at point O with velocity v.
In a magnetic field, a charged particle moving perpendicularly experiences a centripetal force, moving in a circular path.
Centripetal force is given by F = qvB.
Radius of circular path r is determined by r = mv/qB.
Period of circular motion T is given by T = 2πm/qB.
Particle moves in B1 and B2 where B1 = 2B2.
In B1, radius r1 = mv/qB1 and period T1 = 2πm/qB1.
In B2, radius r2 = mv/qB2 and period T2 = 2πm/qB2.
Particle follows a semicircular path in each field, switching at boundary MN.
Time to traverse semicircle in B1 is πm/qB1.
Time to traverse semicircle in B2 is πm/qB2.
Time for particle to pass through point O downward again is t = 3πm/2qB2.
